definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: I think I can make a lot of money in this business.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得可以在這門生意裏賺很多錢。

sentences.english: On hearing their teacher's voice, the pupils stopped talking at once.
sentences.chinese: 一聽到西席的聲音，門生們立即竣事發言。

sentences.english: He gave his daughter in marriage to his favourite pupil.
sentences.chinese: 他把女兒嫁給了他的得意門生。

sentences.english: On his birthday, his students wanted to give him a party.
sentences.chinese: 一次逢王的生日，他的門生想給他祝壽。

sentences.english: He also has several favorite students.
sentences.chinese: 他還有幾位得意門生呢。

sentences.english: All those fundamentals raise questions about the nature of the business.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些都對這門生意的本質提出了疑問”。

sentences.english: Sacramento State can call him their most famous dropout.
sentences.chinese: 薩克拉門託州立小學稱他是該校最著實的停門生。

sentences.english: Many students can't even read, not to mention write, traditional full-form Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 很多門生乃至不能欣賞繁體漢字，更別提謄寫了。

sentences.english: In schools, there are more than 50% of the population has tried marijuana at least once.
sentences.chinese: 在中學裏，趕過50%的門生至少試過一次年夜麻。

sentences.english: The student tried very hard become successful as doctors , teachers or scientists.
sentences.chinese: 門生非常積極成爲樂成的大夫，西席或科學家。

sentences.english: An hour's life there is better than a thousand years in Calormen.
sentences.chinese: 納尼亞生活一小時勝過在卡樂門生活一千年。

sentences.english: Moe loves the business, he never said anything about selling.
sentences.chinese: 莫格林很愛這門生意，他從未對我提過要賣它的事。

sentences.english: Since the Eastern Han Dynasty has been disciples Guli, multiphase and erection Songde.
sentences.chinese: 自後漢以來，門生故吏，多相與立碑頌德。

sentences.english: A: I think I can make a lot of money in this business.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得可以在這門生意裏賺很多錢。

sentences.english: And of course, the best nightclubs have the biggest velvet ropes and the pickiest doormen.
sentences.chinese: 最好的夜總會有着最大的天鵝絨攔繩和最挑剔的門生。

definition: junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
to learn a skill or art
to study/to learn from a master/(pupil's first person pronoun) I, your student
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
friend from whom you can seek advice
to formally become an apprentice to a master
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
